title: Keeping Bruno
description:
Marcus Chen has spent six months becoming invisible—overlooked by bullies at school and barely noticed by his exhausted mother at home since his father left for an overseas work contract. Everything changes when a summer storm damages the local zoo and Marcus discovers Bruno, a terrified four-month-old black bear cub, hiding in his backyard. In an impulsive decision that transforms his life, Marcus hides Bruno in the family garage, finding purpose and connection in caring for someone who needs him.
As their bond deepens, Marcus recruits his former friend Jamie to help maintain the secret, transforming the garage into a proper den. For the first time in months, Marcus feels visible and alive. But as Bruno grows rapidly and the zoo director intensifies her search, Marcus's mother begins noticing the changes in her son. When the truth can no longer be hidden, Marcus faces an impossible choice: return Bruno to the rehabilitation program where he can learn to be wild and free, or keep him and condemn them both to a life in hiding. In learning to let go, Marcus discovers that true love sometimes means sacrifice, and that the bravest act is knowing when to open your hands.
logline: A lonely twelve-year-old finds unexpected purpose when he secretly shelters an escaped bear cub, but as his wild companion grows and the zoo director closes in, he must choose between the connection that's making him whole and doing what's right for the friend he loves.

dynamic_questions.q1: As Bruno grows and Marcus's lies multiply, the reality of the situation becomes impossible to ignore. The cub needs medical care, proper food, and a safe environment that Marcus cannot provide. When Bruno accidentally injures Marcus during play, he's forced to confront a painful truth: loving someone sometimes means letting them go. With help from his best friend Jade and his father, Marcus learns that real courage isn't about holding on to what makes you feel better—it's about doing what's right, even when it breaks your heart. Through his journey with Bruno, Marcus discovers his own voice and realizes he was never truly invisible after all.
dynamic_questions.q4: Being responsible for his pet bear

1.title: The Storm
1.summary: Marcus Chen navigates another invisible day at school, enduring the casual cruelty of being overlooked while his mother works another double shift at the hospital. Six months after his father left for Dubai, Marcus has perfected the art of fading into the background. That night, a violent summer storm tears through their neighborhood, damaging the local zoo's perimeter. The next morning, while his mother sleeps after her shift, Marcus discovers Bruno—a terrified, mud-covered black bear cub—hiding beneath the rhododendrons in their overgrown backyard. In a moment that defies logic but answers a desperate need, Marcus coaxes the shaking cub into the cluttered garage, using leftover chicken from the fridge. As he watches Bruno curl into a corner, Marcus feels something he hasn't felt in months: needed.

scenes.summary: Marcus sits alone in the cafeteria, methodically eating his lunch while students flow around him as if he doesn't exist. When Tyler Brennan's backpack "accidentally" knocks Marcus's water bottle across the table, no one acknowledges it happened—not even Marcus.
scenes.setting: Lincoln High School cafeteria, lunch period
scenes.goal: Establish Marcus's invisible status at school and his emotional isolation six months after his father's departure

scenes.summary: Marcus arrives home to their empty house, finding a note from his mother saying she's picked up another double shift at the hospital. He microwaves leftover chicken and eats dinner alone, scrolling through his father's increasingly brief messages from Dubai.
scenes.setting: The Chen family home, kitchen and living room, early evening
scenes.goal: Show Marcus's home life and the absence of both parents, establishing his profound loneliness

scenes.summary: A violent summer storm strikes in the night with thunder, lightning, and torrential rain. Marcus lies awake listening to branches breaking and debris hitting the house, while somewhere across town, the storm damages the zoo's perimeter fencing.
scenes.setting: Marcus's bedroom, late night during the storm
scenes.goal: Create the inciting incident that allows Bruno to escape; build atmospheric tension

scenes.summary: The next morning, Marcus explores the storm damage in their overgrown backyard while his mother sleeps after her shift. He hears a whimpering sound and discovers Bruno—a small, terrified, mud-covered black bear cub—hiding beneath the rhododendrons.
scenes.setting: The Chen family backyard, early morning
scenes.goal: Introduce Bruno and create the pivotal moment of discovery

scenes.summary: After a tense standoff where Marcus and Bruno study each other, Marcus slowly coaxes the shaking, exhausted cub out with pieces of leftover chicken. He manages to lead Bruno across the yard and into the cluttered garage, his heart pounding with a mixture of fear and exhilaration.
scenes.goal: Show Marcus making the impulsive decision to hide Bruno; demonstrate their first connection

scenes.summary: Marcus watches Bruno curl into a corner of the garage among old boxes and his father's abandoned tools, the cub finally falling into an exhausted sleep. For the first time in six months, Marcus feels genuinely needed and alive, even as he realizes the magnitude of what he's just done.
scenes.goal: End the chapter with Marcus's emotional transformation and hint at the complications to come
scenes.emotional_beat: Purpose and belonging mixed with dawning awareness of consequences

2.title: The Secret
2.summary: Over the next three weeks, Marcus's life transforms around his secret. He takes on odd jobs—mowing lawns, walking dogs—to buy food for Bruno, who grows alarmingly fast, gaining thirty pounds. Marcus masks the smell with his mother's air fresheners and invents elaborate excuses for his constant garage visits. When Jamie, his former best friend, follows him one afternoon and discovers the truth, Marcus expects betrayal. Instead, Jamie offers help, and together they transform the garage into a proper den with stolen hay bales and a kiddie pool. As their friendship rekindles, Marcus experiences joy he'd forgotten existed. Meanwhile, Dr. Sarah Okoye, the zoo's director, appears on local news pleading for information about the missing cub, and reward flyers blanket the neighborhood. Marcus's mother begins noticing changes—his new confidence, mysterious phone calls, constant trips to the garage—and starts asking questions that make Marcus's carefully constructed lies crumble.

scenes.summary: Three weeks into hiding Bruno, Marcus hustles through the neighborhood mowing lawns and walking dogs to earn money for bear food. He stops at the pet store to buy dog food in bulk, lying to the clerk about having multiple large dogs, while mentally calculating how long his cash will last as Bruno's appetite increases.
scenes.setting: Various neighborhood houses, local pet supply store
scenes.goal: Establish Marcus's new routine and the growing challenge of feeding a rapidly growing bear cub

scenes.summary: In the garage, Marcus feeds Bruno and notices he's gained significant weight, his playful wrestling now strong enough to knock Marcus down. Marcus sprays air freshener to mask the animal smell and talks to Bruno about his day, feeling more connected to the cub than anyone else in his life.
scenes.goal: Show the deepening bond between Marcus and Bruno, and the physical reality of hiding a growing bear
scenes.emotional_beat: Tender joy mixed with underlying worry

scenes.summary: Jamie follows Marcus home from school, suspicious of his secretive behavior and sudden unavailability. When Jamie confronts Marcus at the garage door, Marcus tries to deflect, but Jamie pushes past him and discovers Bruno, freezing in shock at the sight of the bear cub.
scenes.goal: Create the pivotal moment when Marcus's secret is discovered by someone from his old life

scenes.summary: After the initial shock, Jamie unexpectedly offers to help rather than expose Marcus's secret. Together, they brainstorm improvements to Bruno's living conditions, and Jamie suggests "borrowing" hay bales from his uncle's farm and getting a kiddie pool, rekindling their old collaborative friendship dynamic.
scenes.goal: Transform Jamie from potential threat to ally, and reestablish their friendship through shared purpose

scenes.summary: Marcus and Jamie watch the evening news with Marcus's mother, where Dr. Sarah Okoye makes an emotional plea for information about the missing cub, explaining that without proper care and eventual rehabilitation, Bruno will never be able to return to the wild. Marcus sees reward flyers on telephone poles and feels the weight of what he's done, while his mother comments on how much happier Marcus seems lately.
scenes.setting: Chen family living room, neighborhood streets
scenes.goal: Introduce the external pressure of the zoo's search and raise the moral stakes of Marcus's decision

scenes.summary: Late at night, Marcus's mother knocks on the garage door, asking pointed questions about his constant visits, the strange smells, and his new friendship with Jamie. Marcus improvises increasingly desperate lies about a "project" while Bruno shuffles in the shadows behind stored boxes, nearly giving himself away, as his mother's suspicion clearly grows despite accepting his explanations for now.
scenes.goal: Escalate tension by showing Marcus's lies beginning to unravel and establish his mother as an imminent threat to the secret
scenes.emotional_beat: Desperate fear and the fragility of Marcus's constructed reality

3.title: Opening Hands
3.summary: The inevitable confrontation arrives when Marcus's mother follows him to the garage and discovers Bruno. Her shock gives way to fear—not for herself, but for Marcus and the cub. She calls Dr. Okoye, and within hours, the zoo director arrives with a specialized team. As Marcus watches them prepare to transport Bruno, Dr. Okoye sits with him and explains the rehabilitation program: Bruno will learn to forage, to fear humans appropriately, to be wild again before being released to a sanctuary. She tells Marcus that his care kept Bruno alive, but keeping him longer would have stolen his chance at a real life. In their final moments together, Marcus holds Bruno close, whispering promises to visit. As the transport van drives away, Jamie stands beside him, and Marcus's mother wraps an arm around his shoulders—truly seeing him for the first time in months. In the weeks that follow, Marcus volunteers at the zoo, watching Bruno's progress through one-way glass. He begins speaking up at school, joining Jamie for lunch, and having real conversations with his mother. When his father video calls, Marcus tells him the whole story, and for once, doesn't pretend everything is fine. Marcus learns that the connection he made with Bruno changed him forever, teaching him that being seen means stepping into the light, and that love—real love—sometimes means letting go.

scenes.summary: Marcus's mother follows him to the garage during his evening feeding routine and discovers Bruno. Her initial shock turns to fear as she realizes the danger her son has been in, and she immediately pulls Marcus away from the cub while demanding an explanation.
scenes.goal: To create the inevitable confrontation that forces Marcus's secret into the open and sets the resolution in motion.
scenes.emotional_beat: Shock and fear transitioning to desperate urgency

scenes.summary: After a tense conversation in the house where Marcus tries to explain his actions, his mother calls Dr. Okoye. Marcus sits in his room, listening to his mother's voice downstairs, knowing his time with Bruno is ending while Jamie arrives to stand with him in these final hours.
scenes.setting: The Chen house (Marcus's room and kitchen)
scenes.goal: To show the aftermath of discovery and Marcus's acceptance that he cannot keep Bruno, while reinforcing his friendship with Jamie.

scenes.summary: Dr. Okoye arrives with a specialized team and calmly assesses Bruno's condition in the garage. She speaks gently to Marcus, acknowledging what he's done for the cub while her team prepares the transport crate, treating both boy and bear with respect and compassion.
scenes.setting: The Chen family garage and driveway
scenes.goal: To introduce Dr. Okoye as a compassionate authority figure who helps Marcus understand the larger picture of Bruno's needs.

scenes.summary: Dr. Okoye sits with Marcus on the driveway while the team works, explaining the rehabilitation program in detail—how Bruno will learn to forage, climb, and fear humans appropriately before eventual release to a sanctuary. She tells Marcus that his care saved Bruno's life, but keeping him would have condemned him to captivity.
scenes.setting: The Chen family driveway, sitting on the curb
scenes.goal: To provide Marcus (and readers) with understanding about wildlife rehabilitation and to reframe Marcus's actions as both heroic and ultimately harmful if continued.

scenes.summary: Marcus is allowed final moments with Bruno before transport. He holds the cub close, whispering promises to visit and apologizing for having to let him go, while Bruno nuzzles him one last time, unaware this is goodbye.
scenes.setting: Inside the transport crate area in the driveway
scenes.goal: To provide an emotional farewell that demonstrates the depth of Marcus and Bruno's bond while showing Marcus's growth in choosing what's best for Bruno.

scenes.summary: As the transport van drives away, Marcus stands with Jamie beside him and his mother's arm around his shoulders—truly being seen and supported by the people in his life. In a montage of the following weeks, Marcus volunteers at the zoo watching Bruno's progress, begins speaking up at school, has real conversations with his mother, and tells his father the whole story over video call, no longer pretending everything is fine.
scenes.setting: Chen family driveway transitioning to multiple locations (zoo, school cafeteria, Chen house kitchen and living room) over several weeks
scenes.goal: To show Marcus's transformation and growth, demonstrating that the connection with Bruno changed him permanently and gave him the courage to be visible in his own life.
